version_description: We've added more control over browsing Setlist.fm performances.

Upgrade with confidence: Playlisty complies with Spotify's latest terms of service so you will continue to get super-fast access to your Spotify playlists with this release. See our full release notes at https://obdura.com/playlisty/v1-21 for more detail.

Lots of new stuff in this version:
• Some UX tweaks to make the Playlist Browser more prominent (thanks for the feedback!)
• Major improvements to Shortcuts functionality & stability. Schedule reliable syncs with 150+ tracks
• An "Add to Siri" button on the Create Playlist screen
• Support for Beatport & Traxsource playlists via weblinks and the Playlisty share extension
• iPad multi-window support
• The "Help" screen is now a lot more ... helpful?

Ever wished you could see all those Apple Music tracks you "Loved" but didn't add to your library? Now you can, with a bit of help from Playlisty. Here's the process:
1). Request a copy of your "Apple Media Services information" from https://privacy.apple.com
2). When you eventually get your zip file, extract "Apple Music Likes and Dislikes.csv" from it
3). Open the file in Playlisty and let it do the rest!
